alert.note: Alert for Taney (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 31 at 3:01AM CDT until March 31 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions this Afternoon and Evening... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WIND AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR SOUTHEAST AND SOUTHWEST MISSOURI... The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a Red Flag Warning for strong wind and low humidity, which is in effect from 2 PM this afternoon to 10 PM CDT this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...In Missouri, Fire Weather Zone 104. * WINDS...Southwest 20 to 25 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 28 percent. * WIND...West to southwest winds of 25-35 mph with gusts of 45- 55 mph. * HUMIDITY...18-28 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
